title: Sony’s Fight Against A Horizon Lookalike Has Come To An End

                Following its decision to sue Tencent for creating a "slavish clone" of its Horizon games, Light of Motiram, Sony has concluded its legal battle with the company. The game is no longer listed on Steam or the Epic Games Store, and the court case has been dismissed.That's according to new court documents filed earlier this week, and Tencent added that it has reached a "confidential settlement" with Sony Interactive Entertainment. "SIE and Tencent are pleased to have reached a confidential resolution and will have no further public comment on this matter," head of communications for Tencent Americas, Sean Durkin, said to The Verge.Announced last year, Light of Motiram was quickly compared to Sony's Horizon series as it featured a very similar art direction and tone to the post-apocalyptic sci-fi series developed by Guerrilla Games. Both games featured vibrant environments and animal-like robots, and Sony was quick to file a lawsuit. Sony and Tencent eventually began discussions to resolve the dispute, with Sony demanding that Tencent pause all public promotion or testing for Light of Motiram.Tencent allegedly pitched Sony a Horizon game set in Asia, which was turned down, and the company later argued that Sony's lawsuit was an attempt to establish a monopoly on Horizon-like games. Sony, in turn, accused Tencent of playing a legal shell game to avoid facing the repercussions of allegedly infringing on its intellectual property.While it looks like Light of Motiram may be no more, a Horizon mobile game is currently in development. Recently, Sony and NCSoft announced a new MMORPG called Horizon Steel Frontiers for both mobile devices and PC.

title: Horses Was Successful Despite Steam And Epic Store Bans, But It May Not Be Enough

                Developer Santa Ragione is reporting that its controversial indie horror game Horses sold 18,000 copies in two weeks. That was apparently enough to save the studio from financial ruin, but perhaps not enough to pay for production a second game.According to a statement released by the developers, Horses generated $65,000 in net revenue, which allowed Santa Ragione to repay its loans and pay the royalties it owed to Andrea Lucco Borlera, the author and creator of Horses. However, the income won't allow the team to immediately begin working on another game."This result is not enough to begin production on a new game," reads the statement. "The money primarily covers obligations created by a prolonged end of development. If sales remain steady, we may be able to fund a new prototype in the future, but the team has had to, and will continue to, take other jobs and projects in the meantime. Reuniting everyone will not be easy, even if it is something we would love."          It's been an uphill battle for Santa Ragione and Horses. The studio recently revealed that its title had been banned by Steam in 2023 without explanation. Subsequently, Horses was also banned by Epic Games Store and Humble Bundle just before its release. The cancellation of Horses by three of the major PC game distributors comes after a recent effort to target adult-oriented games on storefronts like Steam and Itch. There is definitely material meant for mature audiences in Horses, but the development team is calling for more transparency in the industry after it says it wasn't given a chance to make any changes to Horses in order for it to be released on Steam."We also want to emphasize that this outcome should not distract from the broader issue at stake: the need for clearer rules, transparent processes, and meaningful accountability from near monopolistic distribution platforms and the systems they enforce," wrote Santa Ragione's spokesperson. "For every case like Horses that becomes visible, there are many more games that are quietly banned, delisted, or trapped in indefinite review for unclear reasons, with developers too worried about retaliation or future approval to speak publicly. We are grateful to the journalists and outlets who have reported, and who will continue to report, on these cases."Horses is now available for $5 on GOG, and Itch.io.

                There is so much for players to do in Roblox’s The Forge, and one of the most important gameplay features is collecting all of the different ore types. While a major goal of the game is to use the titular forge to craft weapons for combat and money, you need ore to do that.Players can get all of the different types of ore in The Forge using your various pickaxes, and some of The Forge codes that are kicking around may be able to help with that. That said, with dozens of ores available in the highly popular Roblox experience, it can be quite confusing where to find all of them. Here is what you need to know about where to find all the ore in The Forge. We've also got a handy The Forge tier list, so you know which ore is best.Table of Contents [hide]Where to Find All Ore in The Forge - Stonewake’s CrossAll Ore - Forgotten KingdomAll Ore - Goblin Cave and Special LocationsWhat to Do With Ore in The ForgeWhere to Find All Ore in The Forge - Stonewake’s CrossThe general idea is you need a pickaxe equipped to be able to mash at the rocks in the various caves and biomes in The Forge. Destroying these different types of rocks will give you the chance to obtain various ores and stones. There are a few additional gemstones and ores that can be found by defeating certain enemies as well.With well over a dozen different ore for you to find in The Forge with varying locations and rarity types, it can be quite overwhelming. Here are all of the ore locations and how to get them in the initial location of Stonewake’s Cross:Stone (Common Rarity): 1 in 1 chance in PebblesSand Stone (Common): 1 in 2 chance in Pebbles and RocksCopper (Common): 1 in 3 chance in Pebbles, Rocks, and BouldersIron (Common): 1 in 5 chance in Pebbles, Rocks, and BouldersBananite (Common): 1 in 30 chance in Rocks and BouldersCardboardite (Uncommon): 1 in 31 chance in Rocks and BouldersTin (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 7 chance in Rocks and BouldersSilver (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 12 chance in Rocks, Boulders, and Basalt RockGold (Uncommon): 1 in 16 chance in Boulders and Basalt RocksMushroomite (Rare): 1 in 22 chance in Rocks and BouldersPlatinum (Rare): 1 in 28 chance in Boulders and Basalt RocksAite (Epic): 1 in 44 chance in BouldersPoopite (Epic): 1 in 131 chance in Pebbles, Rocks, and BouldersAll Ore - Forgotten KingdomThe Forgotten Kingdom is the second area you will be able to visit in The Forge once you reach level 10 and complete the tutorial quests. Here are all of the ores you will be able to find here:Cobalt (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 37 chance in Basalt Rocks and Basalt CoresTitanium (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 50 chance in Basalt Rocks and Basalt CoresLapis Lazuli (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 73 chance in Basalt Rocks and Basalt CoresVolcanic Rock (Rare): Approximately 1 in 55 chance in Volcanic RocksQuartz (Rare): Approximately 1 in 90 chance in Basalt Rocks, Basalt Cores, and Basalt VeinsAmethyst (Rare): Approximately 1 in 115 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt VeinsTopaz (Rare): Approximately 1 in 143 chance in Volcanic Rocks, Basalt Cores, and Basalt VeinsDiamond (Rare): Approximately 1 in 192 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt VeinsSapphire (Rare): Approximately 1 in 247 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt VeinsBoneite (Rare): Approximately 1 in 222 chance when taking out skeletonsDark Boneite (Rare): Approximately 1 in 555 chance when eliminating elite skeletonsSlimite (Epic): Approximately 1 in 247 chance when eliminating slimesCuprite (Epic): Approximately 1 in 303 chance in Basalt Cores, Basalt Veins, and Volcanic RocksObsidian (Epic): Approximately 1 in 333 chance in Volcanic RocksEmerald (Epic): Approximately 1 in 363 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt VeinsRuby (Epic): Approximately 1 in 487 chance in Basalt VeinsRivalite (Epic): Approximately 1 in 569 chance in Basalt Veins and Volcanic RocksUranium (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 777 chance in Basalt VeinsMythril (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 813 chance in Basalt VeinsEye Ore (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 1333 chance in Basalt Rocks, Basalt Veins, Basalt Cores, and Volcanic RocksMagmaite (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 3003 chance in Volcanic RocksLightite (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 3333 chance in Basalt VeinsFireite (Legendary): Found in Volcanic RocksDemonite (Mythical): Approximately 1 in 3666 chance in Volcanic RocksDarkryte (Mythical): Approximately 1 in 6655 chance in Volcanic RocksAll Ore - Goblin Cave and Special LocationsThe Goblin Cave is one of the late-game areas players are able to visit and mine ore in after the Forgotten Kingdom. Here are all of the ores you can get there, plus some special ores:Blue Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chanceOrange Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chanceGreen Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chanceCrimson Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chancePurple Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chanceRainbow Crystal (Legendary): 1 in 5000 chanceArcane Crystal (Mythical): 1 in 100,000 chanceFichillium (Relic): 1 in 1 chance in Lucky Block RocksWhat to Do With Ore in The ForgeThe point of ore isn’t just to gather it for no reason. The point is to take that ore to the titular forge and use it to craft various items. You are able to get weapons and armor by crafting with the ore at these forge locations in Stonewake’s Cross and the Forgotten Kingdom.Of course, the rarer the ore, the better chances you’ll get a high-quality or even exclusive item. You can then take the items you have crafted using your ore and sell them or even equip them to have better stats to do better against the various enemies in the world. This is why it is vital that you know where to find specific ore, so you are always improving your gear and gaining even more money.There is so much to see and do in Roblox The Forge beyond the overwhelming number of available ores. You should find out the current codes available in The Forge, so you don’t miss out on any free goodies and the tier list for what items are most worth using.
